    Practice makes Pierre-fect! (collective groan)

Orion

Collaborative three.js experiment, made with a friend of mine.

He wrote the initial shader, I polished it and built a little generative app around it.

❮ Back to menu

Launch

Vesuna

Utility to use texts as random seeds.

Replacing the typical Math.random(), it allows to easily save and share generative outcomes.

❮ Back to menu

Open Github

Textformer

Small javascript library for easy text animations, using random character changes. Includes a barebones tweening engine, which was total overkill as it works great with gsap, anime.js etc.

❮ Back to menu

Open Github

Disintegrator

Real-time destruction of three.js meshes.

Tesselation, custom buffer attributes, and a mix of random + simplex noise.

❮ Back to menu

Launch

Sketches

Aiming to constantly learn and improve, I do a lot of small side projects and experiments. I call them "sketches".

They give me the freedom to experiment and try new things.

Infos

About me

Hello!

My name is Pierre "Keda" Aud√©oud. I'm a 38-years-old french creative coder, working freelance and living in Paris. I'm currently looking to join a creative studio full-time.

Most of my code is written in vanilla javascript and three.js, with a strong focus on motion, randomness and interactivity.

I also really like GLSL & sci-fi aesthetics.
